record.dc:title: 14BE3, 15BE3, Boone County, Kentucky. Robbins Large Mound Site. 55' Profile and 50' Profile.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Kentucky Adena and Woodland Mound Sites
record.wpa:narrative: Photograph taken from the south. Wall of foreground block is the 50' Profile and that behind the 55' Profile. This photo unincised, hence structure speaks for itself as with photo 12BE3 which is of same subject. Indicated in this photo is the same structure as in photo 12BE3 except that it is closer to the subject ... consult sheet for photo 12BE3. Burial 1BE3 is located in the notch removed from the foreground block. The overlapping of the loaded earth of the righthand dark eminence over the left is not apparent because of the extreme indistinctness thereof ... consult profile drawings for this data. The hole in the righthand eminence of the darkly loaded section is a ground-hog burrow. In the 55' Profile at the extreme right where it is interrupted by the foreground block is a small dome of bright yellow and grey horizontal loading that is the east wall of the ring about Tomb #1.
